rule.name: SA00001
rule.long: A WS-BPEL processor MUST reject a WS-BPEL that refers to solicit-response or notification operations portTypes.

rule.name: SA00002
rule.long: A WS-BPEL processor MUST reject any WSDL portType definition that includes overloaded operation names.

rule.name: SA00003

type.content: exitOnStandardFault='yes' in <scope> or <process>, but catches standard fault

rule.long: If the value of exitOnStandardFault of a <scope> or <process> is set to 'yes', then a fault handler that explicitly targets the WS-BPEL standard faults MUST NOT be used in that scope.

rule.name: SA00005

type.content: @portType differs from implicit portType defined in <operation>

rule.long: If the portType attribute is included for readability, in a <receive>, <reply>, <invoke>, <onEvent> or <onMessage> element, the value of the portType attribute MUST match the portType value implied by the combination of the specified partnerLink and the role implicitly specified by the activity.

rule.name: SA00006
rule.long: The <rethrow> activity MUST only be used within a faultHandler (i.e. <catch> and <catchAll> elements).

rule.name: SA00007
rule.long: The <compensateScope> activity MUST only be used from within a faultHandler, another compensationHandler, or a terminationHandler.

rule.name: SA00008
rule.long: The <compensate> activity MUST only be used from within a faultHandler, another compensationHandler, or a terminationHandler.

rule.name: SA00010
rule.long: A WS-BPEL process definition MUST import all XML Schema and WSDL definitions it uses. This includes all XML Schema type and element definitions, all WSDL port types and message types as well as property and property alias definitions used by the process.

rule.name: SA00011

type.content: imported targetNamespace differs from expected namespace

rule.long: If a namespace attribute is specified on an <import> then the imported definitions MUST be in that namespace.

rule.name: SA00012
rule.long: If no namespace is specified then the imported definitions MUST NOT contain a targetNamespace specification.

rule.name: SA00013

type.content: imported type differs from expected type

rule.long: The value of the importType attribute of element <import> MUST be set to http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema when importing XML Schema 1.0 documents, and to http://schemas.xmlsoap.org/wsdl/ when importing WSDL 1.1 documents.

rule.name: SA00020
rule.long: A <vprop:propertyAlias> element MUST use one of the three following combinations of attributes: messageType and part, type or element

rule.name: SA00021
rule.long: Static analysis MUST detect property usages where propertyAliases for the associated variable's type are not found in any WSDL definitions directly imported by the WS-BPEL process.

rule.name: SA00022
rule.long: A WS-BPEL process definition MUST NOT be accepted for processing if it defines two or more propertyAliases for the same property name and WS-BPEL variable type.

rule.name: SA00023
rule.long: The name of a variable MUST be unique among the names of all variables defined within the same immediately enclosing scope.

rule.name: SA00024
rule.long: Variable names are BPELVariableNames, that is, NCNames (as defined in XML Schema specification) but in addition they MUST NOT contain the '.' character.

rule.name: SA00025
rule.long: The messageType, type or element attributes are used to specify the type of a variable. Exactly one of these attributes MUST be used.

rule.name: SA00044

type.content: CorrelationSet name must be unique per scope

rule.long: The name of a <correlationSet> MUST be unique among the names of all <correlationSet> defined within the same immediately enclosing scope.

rule.name: SA00045
rule.long: Properties used in a <correlationSet> MUST be defined using XML Schema simple types.

rule.name: SA00046

type.content: There is no attribute 'pattern' in <correlation> within <invoke>
Attribute 'pattern' in <correlation> within <invoke> is not allowed

rule.long: The pattern attribute used in <correlation> within <invoke> is required for request-response operations, and disallowed when a one-way operation is invoked.

rule.name: SA00047
rule.long: One-way invocation requires (<invoke>) only the inputVariable (or its equivalent <toPart> elements) since a response is not expected as part of the operation. Request-response invocation requires both an inputVariable (or its equivalent <toPart> elements) and an outputVariable (or its equivalent <fromPart> elements). If a WSDL message definition does not contain any parts, then the associated attributes variable, inputVariable or outputVariable, MAY be omitted,and the <fromParts> or <toParts> construct MUST be omitted.

rule.name: SA00048

type.content: @inputVariable messageType or type QName differs from the <operation>'s input <message> QName used in <invoke>
@outputVariable messageType or type QName differs from the <operation>'s output <message> QName used in <invoke>

rule.long: When the optional inputVariable and outputVariable attributes are being used in an <invoke> activity, the variables referenced by inputVariable and outputVariable MUST be messageType variables whose QName matches the QName of the input and output message type used in the operation, respectively, except as follows: if the WSDL operation used in an <invoke> activity uses a message containing exactly one part which itself is defined using an element, then a variable of the same element type as used to define the part MAY be referenced by the inputVariable and outputVariable attributes respectively.

rule.name: SA00050

type.content: <toPart> element for an <invoke> / <reply> process is missing

rule.long: When <toParts> is present, it is required to have a <toPart> for every part in the WSDL message definition; the order in which parts are specified is irrelevant. Parts not explicitly represented by <toPart> elements would result in uninitialized parts in the target anonymous WSDL variable used by the <invoke> or <reply> activity. Such processes with missing <toPart> elements MUST be rejected during static analysis.

rule.name: SA00051
rule.long: The inputVariable attribute MUST NOT be used on an invoke activity that contains <toPart> elements.

rule.name: SA00052
rule.long: The outputVariable attribute MUST NOT be used on an <invoke> activity that contains a <fromPart> element.

rule.name: SA00053
rule.long: For all <fromPart> elements the part attribute MUST reference a valid message part in the WSDL message for the operation.

rule.name: SA00054
rule.long: For all <toPart> elements the part attribute MUST reference a valid message part in the WSDL message for the operation.

rule.name: SA00055
rule.long: For <receive>, if <fromPart> elements are used on a <receive> activity then the variable attribute MUST NOT be used on the same activity.

rule.name: SA00059
rule.long: For <reply>, if <toPart> elements are used on a <reply> activity then the variable attribute MUST NOT be used on the same activity.

rule.name: SA00063
rule.long: The semantics of the <onMessage> event are identical to a <receive> activity regarding the optional nature of the variable attribute or <fromPart> elements, if <fromPart>elements on an activity then the variable attribute MUST NOT be used on the same activity (see SA00055).
